revised_title: Morphology and Taxonomy of Deep-Sea Thyasiridae Species in the Atlantic Ocean
tldr: This study describes 25 species and three subspecies of the Thyasiridae family (Bivalvia: Lucinacea) found in the deep Atlantic Ocean. The researchers used shell features and internal morphology to clarify taxonomic divisions and discovered that these deep-sea species share several key features, such as the form of their lateral body pouches. The study also discusses the adaptation of these species to life in deep-sea environments and their wide distribution across the globe.
